page.title: 05COUNTY COUNCILLOR FOR ROMSEY
page.content: Mrs Liz Brett became the Hampshire County Councillor of Romsey and Romsey extra when she won the election on 2nd May 1985. The next election will be held in 1989. Now, after the election, the Council is half Liberal SDP Alliance and Labour and half Conservative. Mrs Brett hopes that this change will make the Council more open. Mrs Brett does not agree with paying to park in Romsey because it makes people park in residential streets and not in the car parks. She told me that to reduce unemployment more maintenance jobs could be made available, such as cleaning drains, renewing roads etc. In the future Mrs Brett thinks that the 3 main parties in the Central Government will be more equally represented and that they will have to be more co-operative with each other.
